We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

While you may find yourself perusing through Costco for grocery finds like party charcuterie platters, affordable Spanish wine, or 12-packs of muffins, you may want to also check out the retailer’s home section. The warehouse store just rolled out a brand-new set filled with bowls and cups, and it boasts a gorgeous vintage feel.

The dinnerware set features designs that were popular during the Baroque era, a period in Europe from the 17th to early 18th century known for its lavish decor. The next time you’re at Costco, be sure to look out for this gem.

This dinnerware set looks luxurious, but its price is a real steal. The 12-piece stoneware set at Costco costs just $19.99, meaning each piece is less than $2. It comes in two matte colors — white and navy blue — and features vintage-inspired gold rims on the bowls and plates. Plus, they are all microwave- and dishwasher-safe.

An Instagram creator, @costcohotfinds, who regularly shares the latest Costco product releases, posted about this dinnerware set, and shoppers quickly flooded the comments with their reactions. One person wrote, “Wow I’m surprised with the ‘gold’ rim that they are microwave-safe! I like them!! Let me stop by Costco.” Another user commented, “Just bought these! Love the look of the darker color.”

This stoneware bowl and plate set with gold rims is currently unavailable on Costco’s website. If you want to snag this deal, you’ll need to visit a warehouse location in person.

The good news is, if you aren’t lucky enough to find this set in stores, there’s a gold-rim bowl set available on Amazon. So, if you’re only looking for bowls, this is perfect for your kitchen. Plus, it’s a great deal!

Still, the gold-rim stoneware set from Costco is an amazing deal, with each piece costing less than $2. So, if you’re at all interested in this collection, you’ll want to head to the warehouse store ASAP to grab a box while you can.
